intro: Cuspidaria lateriflora, commonly known as the side-flowered cuspidaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a typical trait of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Cuspidaria lateriflora is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
